entry.cap:areaDesc: Susitna Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 4:18PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS EXPECTED TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY FOR THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS AND ALASKA PENINSULA... Gusty west-northwesterly winds are expected along the Eastern Aleutians and Alaska Peninsula as a low moves through the Southern Bering Sea. The strongest gusts are expected near Cold Bay around 10 AM
entry.cap:areaDesc: Alaska Peninsula; Eastern Aleutians

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 2:23PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Possible Tuesday Through Thursday... West winds of 25 to 35 mph blowing over a large fetch of open water over the Arctic Ocean and Chukchi Sea will cause elevated water levels potentially 1 to 3 feet above the highest high tide and elevated surf along the Arctic Coast from Tuesday through Thursday. This will likely lead to beach erosion along the Arctic
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 2:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Through Tonight... A mix of Rain and snow has transitioned to snow across most areas this morning and will continue to snow through tonight. Most valley locations will get an inch or two of snow accumulation. Between 2 and 4 inches of snow is expected above 2000 ft by tonight, with areas in the Brooks Range getting up to 6 inches.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued October 09 at 1:30PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain And River Rises Possible Latter Half Of This Week For SE Alaska... An atmospheric river will move over the Gulf of Alaska and into the panhandle for the latter half of this week. This will bring periods of moderate to heavy rain as the moisture band moves over panhandle.

entry.summary: ...Elevated danger for field fires Tuesday... An elevated risk for field fires will develop Tuesday with warm weather and dry conditions prevailing. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:43AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated danger for field fires Tuesday... An elevated risk for field fires will develop Tuesday with warm weather and dry conditions prevailing. By Tuesday afternoon, south winds will become breezy at 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph greatly increasing the risk for spreading fires as minimum relative humidity levels drop to between 30 and 40 percent.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Allen; Defiance; Fulton; Henry; Paulding; Putnam; Van Wert; Williams

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 09 at 1:36AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... The Lane Regional Air Protection Agency has continued an Air Quality Advisory, which is in effect until 5 AM PDT Wednesday. A Smoke Air Quality Advisory remains in effect. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels at times through Wednesday

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Frost Possible Early This Morning... Patchy frost is possible this morning, especially across sheltered valleys as low temperatures drop into the mid to upper 30s. While the frost is not expected to be widespread, where frost does occur, sensitive outdoor plants may be damaged or killed if left unprotected.
